summary: the world health organization (WHO) interim guidelines provide infection control guidance to help prevent transmission of acute respiratory diseases in health care. new evidence on some specific and controversial areas has emerged, necessitating an update of the guidelines. the authors used a peer-reviewed search strategy to search the following electronic bibliographic databases: PubMed, Embase, MEDLINE, CINAHL, and The Cochrane Library. the initial search was completed in November 2010, with regular alerts established in Embase, MEDLINE, and PubMed and running until September 19, 2011. results The literature search yielded 1,146 citations. 158 were deemed potentially relevant and retrieved for more detailed evaluation. seven studies met inclusion criteria for systematic review. the failure to consider harms could significantly underestimate the cost-effectiveness. the feasibility of generalizing results among respiratory virus type needs to be evaluated. the majority of the evidence pertains to hospital populations.
